name: Waterfront Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife, kids and I stayed for a few nights break and absolutely loved the experience. From the new tv's, new beds, carpet and freshly painted rooms to the friendly courteous staff, we absolutely loved it! Next time we hope the weather will be a bit warmer so we can use the nice clean pool and barbecue area. We look forward to our next stay.
reviews.title: so much improved and loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: Thanks again.
reviews.title: Fantastic, clean, convenient and friendly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've come from Melbourne to stay here in Hobart. Had no idea what this hotel would be like - expecting just a bed. But walked into a VERY clean and secure place. Little kitchenette with microwave an bar fridge, comfy bed with really nice linnen and good pillows. Good sized shower with great water pressure. Lol. No hair dryer and very minimal storage space for longer stays but absolutely would come again. Nice and quiet too. Close to shops. Beautiful view over river and neat back courtyard area and lovely pool ( if it ever gets warm enough to use it) good powerful heater in room and very soft and comfy electric blanket! No DVD player but decent sized tv :) highly recommend!
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean, comfortable, warm, friendly and peaceful. We had a great value room which welcomed the morning sun. Thanks for a lovely stay.
reviews.title: just for traveller

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spend 2 nights on here,we do not feel happy,the staff is not so warmly,the room is smaller and far from city center.
reviews.title: mrs happy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only about 10 minutes from Hobart CBD, your own transport is definitely needed. We stayed six nights in total on our first visit to Tasmania. We had room 1 on the top floor, which had huge windows overlooking the Derwent River and also Mt Wellington. Due to the cold weather, we mostly had to keep the curtains closed. The bed was very comfortable and was supplied with 'his and hers' electric blanket (each side of the bed was adjustable temperature as required), and it's just as well. Although the rooms had recently been nicely refurbished, the fan heaters had been removed and replaced with oil-type heaters which really only warmed towels before a shower or dried them after showers! These oil heaters were not adequate to heat the rooms, and when we mentioned this to the manager, he said that other guests had said the same thing. Room 1 also had a small kitchenette (toaster, coffee making facilities, fridge, microwave oven and sink). I had booked this motel online and requested the room with the spa, but on arrival was offered Room 1 as an alternative due to the length of our stay because the spa room had no views at all! After seeing other hotels, motels and B&Bs in Hobart when on the ground, I doubt if I would chose to stay at the Waterfront again.
reviews.title: Quiet area in Hobart suburbs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I was a single women traveller. At first glance from the carpark I was very concerned from the exterior of the motel rooms when I arrived in the rear carpark and asked if I would be placed in one of the rooms from above. After much thought the manager did give me a room above, I was very grateful, I would not have stayed otherwise and would have just counted my loss. For what ever reason the rooms on the lower ground level don't look inviting,and I felt vunerable there by myself.Thankyou for upgrading me,I would stay there again for my short stay visiting friends.Rooms have been refurbished which goes along way, new carpet, fresh paint,good size LCD TV kitchnette with crockery ect and microwave. I would assume that costs are saved by no frills...No tissues,phone note pads or hair dryers, airconditioning. I did like the sloping open windows. Had to park up the street first night as no carpark was available. For the money I paid it served it's purpose. Good luck with maintaining inprovements....The motel was only a 20 minute drive for me to my friends.
reviews.title: good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Convenient location on quiet road, 10 mins. to City centre, most pleasant suburban surroundings with river and mountain outlook.
reviews.title: Ideal place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apartments are generously appointed — modern, fresh and cheerful, and totally quiet. No aspect of comfort, convenience or service is less than ideal.
reviews.title: Great price in a comfy motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Guests’ kitchen is an excellent feature, well-equipped, very clean and a pleasure to use.
reviews.title: average hotel even at budget prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 weeks with a friend while attending a sorting event. Room size was fair with one double & one single bed taking up most of the floor space. 2 chairs & small table made for cramped living. Only a small clothes cupboard so we had to keep hunting through our bags for clothes. small kitchenette, mirco wave, jug, toaster & bar size fridge. corner shower with good hot water and pressure.
reviews.title: OK for a short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a larger shared kitchen & a coin operated washing machine & drier. Car park was often full so had to park in street, but as this a quite area was not a problem. Public bus is nearby but having own transport makes getting around easier.
reviews.title: basic but comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In a beautiful location, but a little out of Hobart, so choices of places to eat is limited without transport. A fairly local supermarket though if you want to provide your own supplies to cook. The local 'pub' also did good food and there was a local pizza outlet too.
reviews.title: Good Value Clean Room Good Location Just out of the City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You get what you pay for and, whilst the hotel was very reasonably priced, it was clean, and comfortable, but basic. Fine for a night or two, but probably not for a weeks holiday.
reviews.title: serenity!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: The guy on reception was helpful.
reviews.title: great value...nice staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this establishment. The room was not clean, light fittings and power switches did not work. You could hear everything along the corridor and in the neighbouring rooms. I was there for four days and I think the beds were made twice during that time. I asked for the towels to be changed, they weren't. I ordered conitinental breakfast for a certain time as I had to be at events - one morning it arrived an hour and a half late. The manager is doing his best (it's been 5 months since he took over), but his changes will not happen quickly enough to improve the place.
reviews.title: How bad can a motel get!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looking at earlier Trip Advisor reports one could easily have made an alternate booking but this is an establishment which is hell bent on improving itself and whilst I have given it an overall rating of ‘average’ the manager deserves an unqualified ‘excellent’ for his efforts in reversing what was clearly a downward spiral under the previous ownership.
reviews.title: One to watch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Peter informed me that the ownership and management had changed in the last few months and already a number of refurbishments had taken place, certainly new carpets and redecoration give the whole place a fresh appearance.
reviews.title: Great Value annd Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hopefully the new owners complete what they have started because there are a few areas in need of attention; one can overlook minor inconveniences and future Trip Advisors may like to keep us all up to date.
reviews.title: Goood spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: We found Peter a laid back individual but never the less a proactive person who went out of his way to sort out any needs that we had, for example a faulty iron was graciously replaced at 9.45 at night which is what I call service. I’d have no hesitation in returning if only to assess the improvements that the new owners and manager are promising to implement.
reviews.title: Filthy. I cannot recommend this motel to anyone. See first, pay later.

description: Please note Waterfront Lodge is under new managment.
